oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of transportation to and commingling at an auction market on the upper and lower respiratory tract bacterial communities of recently weaned calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stroebel, Christina
Alexander, Trevor
Timsit, Edouard
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine respiratory disease
BRD
beef cattle
auction markets
transportation
commingling
weaned beef calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Commingling at auction markets is considered a major predisposing factor for bovine respiratory disease (BRD) in beef cattle. However, the extent to which commingling may affect the bacterial communities of the respiratory airways is largely unknown. The objective of this study was to evaluate the effects of transportation to and commingling at an auction market on the upper and lower respiratory tract microbiotas of recently weaned beef calves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2018; 280
